pullsbody:
Fixes #50


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #50.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Fix create zone to use transactions
pullsbody: @rhelmer, mind doing an r? ?
pull_commit_message:
Create nameserver records *before* associating SOA record

Inventory will error out if you try to create a zone (asign a new SOA to
a domain) and do not have NS records in the zone. This patch changes the
create_zone behavior to create NS records for a zone's root domain
before assinging the new SOA record. This also means dns build jobs are
not scheduled when the NS records are added (because their domain
doesn't have a SOA yet) so the tests were also updated to reflect that
change.
Renamed the CSS class dns-title to inv-title (it's used outside of dns forms) and added the chosen plugin to a few base templates

Added functions for displaying mozillian links

Add allocation so searchables and search results

This requires the Allocation class to have a __str__ method and a field
called `search_fields`.

pulltitle: add script to convert a domain to use akamai nameservers
pull_commit_message: add script to convert a domain to use akamai nameservers

Added tests and updated existing tests

Moved to using rich python data structures for debug compiler results
instead of using strings and string comparison.

The new tests mostly cover the new EQ operator types.
small style fixes

Extend parsley definition

We want to be able to handle:
    * quoted directive values
    * parsing <class>.<attribute><equality-operator><value>
        - For example: sys.hostname~foobar

We also parsed out the regex parsing to reuse it in other parts of the
grammar.

Add compiler back-end features

This patch adds the following:
    * model introspection for search directives
    * inequality search operators
    * explicit strict equality and fuzzy equality search operators

We want users to be able to specify which fields on a model they want to
search. The syntax for specifying the field is shared with how django
annotates searches in Q objects (using '__' to specify traversing to a
related model.)

For example, say a user wanted to filter on systems with the status
'production'. They can now search:

    sys.system_status__name='production'

Internally, the compiler will parse the rhs to:

    directive -> 'sys'
    dattribute -> 'system_status__name'
    dvalue -> 'production'
    eq -> '='

It will then attempt to verify that 'system_status' corresponds to a
relational field on the 'sys' (System) class and that the model
referenced by 'system_status' (SystemStatus) has a field 'name'. If
things checkout the compiler will pass along a Q object for filtering
systems that looks like:

    Q(**{"system_status__name": "production"})

The following query is also now supported:

    sys.hostname~admin1 sys.server_model__vendor~HP \
        sys.purchase_date>=2014-01-01 sys.notes="/foo ba[zr]"

This search does a fuzzy search for systems with "admin1" in their
hostname, selects for servers who's server model is supplied by vendors
with "HP" in their name, were purchased after (or equal to) January 1st
2014, and that atch the regular expression "foo ba[zr]"
Add tests for new model introspection search features

Expose which fields can be searched on a models

This patch mainly introduces discover_for_class() which introspects a
model to see which fields can be searched. The results are shown to the
user via the help button on the search page.
mysql can raise Warnings
update help docs to use = instead of '=:'
s/gaurd/guard/
Use border-style CSS instead of border html attribute
Looks fine without fiddling with table border attribute
Add the ability for a user to RESTfully query the schema of a specific class

Add search features

This patch adds the following:
    * model introspection for search directives
    * inequality search operators
    * explicit strict equality and fuzzy equality search operators
    * quoted search terms for the left hand side of directives
    * refactored test code

Users can now specify what field on a model they want to search. The
syntax for specifying the field is shared with how django annotates
searches in Q objects (using '__' to specify traversing to a related
model.)

For example, say a user wanted to filter on systems with the status
'production'. They can now search:

    sys.system_status__name='production'

Internally, the compiler will parse the rhs and attempt to verify that
'system_status' corresponds to a relational field on the 'sys' (System)
class and that the model referenced by 'system_status' (SystemStatus)
has a field 'name'. If things checkout the compiler will pass along a Q
object for filtering systems that looks like:

    Q(**{"system_status__name": "production"})

The following query is now supported:

    sys.hostname~admin1 sys.server_model__vendor~HP \
        sys.purchase_date>=2014-01-01 sys.notes="/foo ba[zr]"

This search does a fuzzy search for systems with "admin1" in their
hostname, selects for servers who's server model is supplied by vendors
with "HP" in their name, were purchased after (or equal to) January 1st
2014, and that also have a notes field that match the regular expression
"foo ba[zr]"

make sure regular directives only allow the strict equality operator.

If a director wants to support something like ~ or >, they just need to
remove the call to the gaurd function.

Run post_handler in a transaction and rollback if there were errors.

This is a bandaid to get things running in a transaction since currently
they are not. Ideally we would run more of the view in a transaction.
Make all dns api actions run in transactions
Make tests run in a TransactionTestCase

pullsbody:
An example of what SANITY_CHECKS would look like is:

```
SANITY_CHECKS = [
    (os.path.join(PROD_DIR, 'com/mozilla/mozilla.com.public'), (
        (r'^mozilla\.com\.\s+(\d+\s+)?IN\s+A\s+'),
        (r'^mozilla\.com\.\s+(\d+\s+)?IN\s+AAAA\s+'),
        (r'^mozilla\.com\.\s+(\d+\s+)?IN\s+MX\s+'),
    )),
]
```
pull_commit_message:
Add configurable sanity check routine

An example of what SANITY_CHECKS would look like is:
SANITY_CHECKS = [
    (os.path.join(PROD_DIR, 'com/mozilla/mozilla.com.public'), (
        (r'^mozilla\.com\.\s+(\d+\s+)?IN\s+A\s+'),
    )),
]

pulltitle: Update objects instead of deleteing when creating new domains
pullsbody:
When a new domain is created and we need to shuffle objects around to
maintain the invariant that domains never conflict with dns objects,
update the existing objects to fit into the new tree instead of deleting
them and then recreating them.
pull_commit_message:
Update objects instead of deleteing when creating new domains

When a new domain is created and we need to shuffle objects around to
maintain the invariant that domains never conflict with dns objects,
update the existing objects to fit into the new tree instead of deleting
them and then recreating them.

We also want to run the build scripts in a transaction to attempt to
shield it from seeing the shuffling we are doing.

pull_commit_message: added nagios alert file
code formating
moved tests

added get_incremented_serial function

get_incremented_serial should be used to correctly get an SOA's 'next' serial while maintaining the correct format

renamed new_serial to safe_serial

new_serial is misleading because it might not be the serial that is eventually set on the SOA. safe_serial makes more sense because it's the serial that will be used to calculate next_serial.
fixed some of the issues @ngokevin mentioned
added a comment to clarify why the serial is being set to such a specific format.
allow the SOA class to decide the default serial

rework calc_serial

Using datetime.date objects now, as they have proven to lead to a cleaner implementation.
